IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: To build decent, affordable housing in partnership with families in need.
IRS990.MissionDesc: To build decent, affordable housing in partnership with families in need.
IRS990.Desc: Our Towns Habitat for Humanity is working to address the issue of affordable housing in North Mecklenburg and Iredell counties to help ensure everyone has a safe, decent place to live. We continued to achieve this goal in 2017, serving more than 270 people with our new construction, critical repair, and financial education programs. Last year, Our Towns Habitat built 15 new homes alongside low-income families. These homeowners each contribute a minimum of 400 hours of sweat equity in education classes, working on the homes of others and their own home. Last year, homeowners completed more than 7,800 hours of sweat equity, before purchasing their homes with a mortgage they can afford to pay. Those mortgage payments help fund future Habitat homes, helping others to realize the dream of home ownership. As a result, of this work, 60 adults and children were served through the new construction programand 18 children moved into safe, decent homes. In addition to new construction, Our Towns Habitat helps to preserve existing homes by completing critical repairs for homeowners, many who are elderly or living with disabilities, who are unable to make those repairs on their own. We completed 42 repair projects, benefitting 46 adults and children in 2017.Our Towns provides financial education and counseling to homebuyers in our program, as well as offering classes to the general public. 167 families were served through our financial education and counseling services last year.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Our Towns Habitat helps to fund the mission of creating and preserving affordable housing through the operation of ReStores, resale stores offering new and gently used furniture, home accessories, building materials and appliances at below-market prices. Our Towns operates ReStores in Cornelius and Mooresville, NC, and opened a new store in Statesville in April 2018. Net proceeds from the three stores generated funding for the construction of nearly five homes locally, and contributed to Habitats global housing work, funding homes and healthy home solutions, such as water filtration and smokeless stoves, for 65 families in Guatemala.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b: Form 990 Review Process
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: No review was or will be conducted.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15b: Compensation Review and Approval Process for Officers and Key Employees
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Executive committee uses Guidestar.org as a guideline to determine compensation for officers and key employees.
